reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The stay cost us £240 which is not cheap but overall we felt it worthwhile for a special occasion. The room was comfortable and in fitting with the historic building which is a welcome change from some of the modern shoeboxes. On the downside the shower was very weak and there was some rust on the bath.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was no iron in the room but one was provided by houskeeeping.
reviews.title: Very comfortable

reviews.text: We knew as soon as we walked into Simonstone Hall for the first time that it would be the perfect venue for our forthcoming wedding. The location is stunning and the hotel has a wonderfully relaxed and cosy ambiance - exactly what we were looking for!
reviews.title: Wow! where do we start...

likes.disliked: — Give yourserlves time to take in the spectacular views en route to the hotel

reviews.title: Hmmm, Could do Better
reviews.text: From the outset, we were promised that "nothing would be too much trouble" and over the weekend itself, they were certainly true to their word. The management, wedding co-ordinator and staff could not have been more friendly and attentive, making ourselves and our guests feel very welcome.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are luxurious and each has its own unique character - all spotlessly clean too (although, being hyper-critical, a couple are looking a little jaded). The choice and quality of the food surpassed our expectations and was served to over 40 guests, fresh and piping hot - no mean feat for any kitchen.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took the opportunity to book the entire hotel for our guests which created a great "house-party" atmosphere but we had been equally impressed on a prior visit when just the two of us stayed.
reviews.title: A Real Treat!!

reviews.text: We had many compliments back from our guests on our choice of venue (some of whom are not easy to please) - well done Simonstone Hall... thank you and see again you soon.
reviews.title: excelllent hotel

reviews.text: My husband and I recently spent 2 nights at the Simonstone Hall Hotel. The hotel was beautiful - it managed to retain an air of old fashioned charm whilst at the same time was modern and contemporary. It is also set in a stunning location. The staff were polite and attentive - nothing was too much trouble for them. As for the food - well, lets just say that my mouth is watering at the thought of it!!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: Without doubt I would return to this hotel.
reviews.title: Fabulous Rural Accomodations in the Dales

description: Simonstone Hall, once home to Lord and Lady Wharncliff is set at the foot of Stags Fell with breathtaking Views over Upper Wensleydale, the River Ure and the foothills of the Pennine range. This magnificent country house, is privately owned and has been carefully restored, whilst preserving the historic character of the beautiful building. Standing in it's own splendid grounds, the view from the front of the hotel is surely one of the most stunning in the country and can e enjoyed from serveral of the bedrooms also.Simonstone Hall is the ultimate tranquil retreat; it's atmosphere exudes comfort and finery in equal measures. From the moment you arrive you feel welcomed and indulged. A grand staircase leads to the second floor where a selection of elegant hotel bedrooms can be found.Relaxing lounges with log fires provide the perfect heven to relax and unwind. With spectacular views from both the Brasserie and Four Fells restaurant, it's the perfect place to enjoy a relaxed or intimate dinner.
